channel.title: My Poor Bro
channel.description: Well, my little brother was diagnosed with Dyslexia. I feel sorry for him. Make fun of him and you're a fuck wit.

item.title: My Poor Bro
item.dc:creator: @cant_touch_this93 cant touch this93
item.description:
@cant_touch_this93 wrote:

[quote=“Pookey71, post:38, topic:136147”]Just make shure you comfort him? I mean, so what if he has Dyslexia, it isn’t a terminal disease.
I mean http://www.thebestpageintheuniverse.net/c.cgi?u=creeve explains sorta what I’m trying to say, I mean, you might not of given a fly kangaroo one way or the other, but I don’t wanna flame teh Yz.So, just try and help him or something?[/quote] You make it sound almost fun.[br][size=1]Posted on: August 23, 2007, 07:14:50 PM[/size][hr]What does that have to do with anything?

Read full topic

item.title: My Poor Bro
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

fellixombc:

i had to have speech therappy since i was in preschool, 8 years -.-, and yet im smart

I’ve had speech therapy for 6 years. I still talk funny sometimes when I don’t pay attention to what I’m saying. and I have a slight lisp…

As for yz, sorry I can’t help. I’ve never actually known anyone with Dyslexia.

Read full topic

item.title: My Poor Bro
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:33, topic:136147”]Well, at the start I thought it was much worse. But it turned out it wasn’t as bad as I thought Dyslexia was. But he has a pretty severe case of it.

The point on posting this thread was asking advice. I actually typed what should I do to help him etc. But I got a time out when posting. Rewrote it like this quickly and didn’t expect it too go through. But it did.
So, I’ll ask it in this post. What should I do to help him?[/quote]
Tell him not to give up because it can be frustrating and also tell him if hes going through hell keep going, as that’s how you get out of there.

Read full topic

item.title: My Poor Bro
item.dc:creator: @Heaven Heaven
item.description:
@Heaven wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Dyslexia

Dyslexia, also known as reading disorder, is characterized by trouble with reading despite normal intelligence. Different people are affected to varying degrees. Problems may include difficulties in spelling words, reading quickly, writing words, "sounding out" words in the head, pronouncing words when reading aloud and understanding what one reads. Often these difficulties are first noticed at school. When someone who previously could read loses their ability, it is known as al Dyslexia is be...


Would that help? Wikipedia should have a few answers

Read full topic

item.title: My Poor Bro
item.dc:creator: @cant_touch_this93 cant touch this93
item.description:
@cant_touch_this93 wrote:

Not much you can do tbh. Just tell him to re-read sentences twice. Thats what i do. I read over something once, then re-read if it dosent make sences. Alsough, When hes reading textbooks/ anything with small text, after a while hell get angry and wana stop probly. Reading it out loud helpes a bunch if your willing to sit there and read it too him.

Read full topic

item.title: My Poor Bro
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Well, at the start I thought it was much worse. But it turned out it wasn’t as bad as I thought Dyslexia was. But he has a pretty severe case of it.

The point on posting this thread was asking advice. I actually typed what should I do to help him etc. But I got a time out when posting. Rewrote it like this quickly and didn’t expect it too go through. But it did.
So, I’ll ask it in this post. What should I do to help him?

Read full topic

item.title: My Poor Bro
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

I also am dyslexic and although you have to work harder it doesn’t mean you can’t be happy. I’m sorry to hear that he has it because no one should have to go through that but as others have said, it could be a lot worse.
